#define HWA_EINVAL   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-1)
 Error Code: Invalid argument.
 
#define HWA_ENOINIT   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-2)
 Error Code: Operation cannot be done as HWA_init is not done.
 
#define HWA_EOUTOFRANGE   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-3)
 Error Code: input argument out of range.
 
#define HWA_EOUTOFMEM   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-4)
 Error Code: out of memory.
 
#define HWA_ENOTSUPP   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-5)
 Error Code: feature not supported.
 
#define HWA_EINUSE   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-6)
 Error Code: channel or resource in use.
 
#define HWA_ENOTALIGNED   (MMWAVE_ERRNO_HWA_BASE-7)
 Error Code: address is not aligned to the expected boundary.

int32_t HWA_getDMAconfig (HWA_Handle handle, uint8_t dmaTriggerSrc, HWA_SrcDMAConfig *dmaConfig)
 Function to get the config to program the DMA for a given DMA Trigger channel. Application should use the returned config to program the DMA so that it can then in turn trigger the paramset. Application should make sure that the channel provided here in dmaTriggerSrc should match the HWA_ParamConfig_t::dmaTriggerSrc passed to HWA_configParamSet() More...
 
int32_t HWA_configRam (HWA_Handle handle, uint8_t ramType, uint8_t *data, uint32_t dataSize, uint32_t startIdx)
 Function to set the HWA RAM (either Internal RAM or window RAM) More...

 Function to enable the CPU interrupt after all programmed paramSets have been completed. More...

int32_t HWA_disableDoneInterrupt (HWA_Handle handle)
 Function to disable the CPU interrupt after all programmed paramSets have been completed. More...
 
int32_t HWA_enable (HWA_Handle handle, uint8_t flagEnDis)
 Function to enable the state machine of the HWA. This should be called after paramset and RAM have been programmed. More...

int32_t HWA_setDMA2ACCManualTrig (HWA_Handle handle, uint16_t idx)
